scene_user_flow.interface: Sidebar now shows a large blue 'Connect with Facebook' button and reassurance that the app will never post without permission.
scene_user_flow.description: The interface reassures Maria that it won’t post without permission, but does not disclose that it will pull real name, profile photo, and friend list into her current account, bypassing her use of a stage name.

scene_user_flow.interface: System links her Facebook account, accessing her name, profile picture, and friend list.
scene_user_flow.description: The Music app uses Facebook OAuth to collect personal identifiers without making it clear that this information will replace her stage-name identity within the app.

privacy_dark_pattern_detection.dark_pattern_explanation: This is a classic case of 'Privacy Zuckering,' where users are tricked into sharing more personal information than intended. Maria linked a Facebook account under the impression that it would only enhance her friend discovery, but the system covertly replaced her anonymous stage-name persona with her real identity—violating her privacy preferences and putting her at risk.

scene_user_flow.interface: Sidebar now shows a large blue 'Connect with Facebook' button and reassurance that the app will never post without permission.
scene_user_flow.description: The interface lacks a contextual warning that real identity information from Facebook will be made visible to existing followers in the app.

privacy_dark_pattern_detection.dark_pattern_explanation: This pattern hides critical information in a misleading reassurance ('will not post') while omitting that Facebook profile data will become publicly visible. The lack of context prevents Maria from making an informed decision about linking accounts—especially dangerous given her need for strict privacy boundaries.

scene_user_flow.description: The system fails to clearly indicate the consequence of account linking (public display of Facebook name and image), resulting in unpredictable and harmful outcomes.

privacy_dark_pattern_detection.dark_pattern_explanation: Feedforward Ambiguity misleads the user by suggesting a simple account connection to view friends’ listening history, while concealing the full extent of visibility and identity merging that follows. This discrepancy between interface cue and system behavior directly contradicts Maria’s intent to maintain separation between her identities.

scene_user_flow.interface: System links her Facebook account, accessing her name, profile picture, and friend list.
scene_user_flow.description: There is no visible or accessible option for Maria to undo the Facebook sync or revert to her stage name, trapping her in an unwanted state.

privacy_dark_pattern_detection.dark_pattern_explanation: This pattern creates an easy way to opt into identity-sharing (via Facebook), but makes it difficult—or impossible—for Maria to return to her previous pseudonymous setup. This traps her in a state that she did not foresee and cannot easily undo, escalating the risk of doxxing.

scene_user_flow.interface: Friend Activity sidebar displays the questionable friend.
scene_user_flow.description: No apparent way to audit what personal data has already been shared with synced friends or to prevent exposure retroactively.

privacy_dark_pattern_detection.dark_pattern_explanation: Despite realizing the privacy breach, Maria finds no way to check what the other user has seen or revoke access to previously exposed activity. The system provides no transparency or remediation, cutting off her ability to fully control the damage, characteristic of a 'Dead End'.

scene_user_flow.interface: Click the profile picture in the top-right corner.
scene_user_flow.description: To activate Private Session, Maria must dig through a non-obvious drop-down menu with multiple unrelated options.

privacy_dark_pattern_detection.dark_pattern_explanation: The design obscures privacy-enhancing settings (like Private Session) within a non-intuitive menu, deterring users from easily protecting themselves. This additional navigation burden delays Maria’s response during a critical privacy breach moment, constituting a 'Privacy Maze'.
